results.title: Queen cotton
results.creator_credit: C Beaumont, Cecil Musk and Merton Park
results.brief_description: Looks at the cotton industry in Lancashire which, in the middle of this century, supplied most of the world with cotton goods. Features cranes on the docks in Manchester unloading cotton from all over the world to supply the looms of Lancashire. Includes a fashion shows highlighting cotton fabrics used by well-known British designers. Photographed by Jimmy Rogers, music by William Alwyn and editing by C. Beaumont.
results.creator_credit_for_label: C Beaumont, Cecil Musk and Merton Park

results.title: Game Masters: Rob Murray interview
results.brief_description:
In this interview, featured as part of the ‘Game Masters’ exhibition, Rob Murray speaks about his career as a game designer. Starting out as a solo developer for hire to becoming CEO of Firemint, Murray is one of the most successful indie game developers in existence.

Firemint’s success is due to Murray’s vision to create games such as ‘Flight Control’(2009) and’ Real Racing’ (2009), which are both easy to play and elegant and addictive in equal measure. In addition, his prescient reading of the drive towards personalised gaming, led by the ubiquity of social networking on mobile platforms, has kept his games on trend – ‘Flight Control’, for example, allows players to choose music from their personal libraries to accompany the game.

Rob talks about the rise of mobile based gaming and the development of ‘Flight Control’ and ‘Real Racing’ .

results.title: To my dearest beloved one - Shewitey Mearey
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. “I said to the doctor, I don’t care if I die tomorrow but I don’t want to leave my daughter alone. He said to me that first I had to live before I could have another child.”
results.title_for_label: To my dearest beloved one - Shewitey Mearey

results.title: Game Masters: Tim Schafer interview
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, ACMI Content Development, ACMI Media Studio and ACMI
results.brief_description:
In this interview, featured as part of the Game Masters exhibition, Tim Schafer speaks about his career as a game designer, starting at LucasArts and then founding his own production company Double Fine Productions. Tim discusses his influences, drawn heavily from the cultural folk law of Mexico, the psychological study of dreams, his love of heavy metal music and the writing of Raymond Chandler and Kurt Vonnegut Jr. With the progression of emerging technology his game aesthetics and character development have evolved, cementing Tim Schafer and Double Fine Productions’ place in games history.

Tim talks about his inspirations and work practices in developing the following games: ‘Full Throttle’, ‘Grim Fandango’, ‘Psychonauts’ and ‘Brutal Legend’. NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Kenneally, ACMI Content Development, ACMI Media Studio and ACMI

results.title: The Devil's toy
results.creator_credit: Claude Jutra, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The skateboard gave the youngsters, who mastered its technique, a thrilling sensation of speed unexcelled by any other pavement sport. Filmed in 1966 on Montreal streets before the elongated rollerskate was banned, this film captures the exuberance of boys and girls having the time of their lives in free-wheeling downhill locomotion. Music by Pierre Brault. Sung by Genevieve Bujold.

results.title: A Day to remember
results.brief_description: A young CFA volunteer who spent her 21st birthday on duty during the bushfires of February 2009. Her entire family is involved in the CFA as volunteer firefighters. She speaks about the poignancy of seeing an Australian flag on a resident’s home during ‘Black Saturday’.
results.description: A young CFA volunteer who spent her 21st birthday on duty during the bushfires of February 2009. Her entire family is involved in the CFA as volunteer firefighters. She speaks about the poignancy of seeing an Australian flag on a resident’s home during ‘Black Saturday’.

results.title: Let's talk cricket
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Alice Jackson Walsh
results.brief_description: Alice, a Gungarri Elder from Echuca, is the former president of the Campapse Cricket Association and Warma Indigenous Cricket Club. In this warm story she reminisces about her lifelong love affair with one of our national pastimes - and reveals its social importance and grass roots support by Australians.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Alice Jackson Walsh

results.title: Growing up fast
results.creator_credit: John Croxford, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: It was itchy feet that encouraged John Croxford to join the Australian Navy. He spent most of his time patrolling the Korean coast where there was no room for mistakes.
